section.p:
The WSDL2Java goal will generate Java source files that are dependent on WebSphere libraries from a wsdl document, along with the IBM specific artifacts
ibm-webservicesclient-bnd.xmi
ibm-webservicesclient-ext.xmi
xxxxx_mapping.xml
webservicesclient.xml
These will be located in the META-INF directory. A subdirectory "wsdl" will also be generated.

Running the WSDL2java task from the commandline is done using the following syntax:
mvn was5:WSDL2Java -DwasHome=<install dir of WebSphere> \ -Durl=<path to wsdl> \ -Doutput=<path to directory to generate sources in>
section.h2: Running WSDL2Java with definition in pom
section.p:
Running the WSDL2java task with the definition defined in the build section of the pom:
<dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency> </dependencies>
<build> <plugins> <plugin> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <executions> <execution> <id>generate-javacode</id> <phase>generate-sources</phase> <goals> <goal>WSDL2Java</goal> </goals> <configuration> <url>ValutaKurserWS.wsdl</url> <output> ${project.build.sourceDirectory} </output> <wasHome> C:/Programfiles/WebSphere/AppServer </wasHome> </configuration> </execution> </executions> </plugin> </plugins> </build>
